alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 10:28AM CDT until May 13 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 230 PM CDT. * At 1026 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated training thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Radar estimates between 2 and 3 inches of rain has fallen across central Okfuskee county with rain rates near 2 inches per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flooding include... Okemah... Okfuskee... Boley... Paden... Bearden... Castle... Welty... Mason... The band of heavy rainfall producing storms is shifting north, so western and northern portions of Okfuskee county may see some flash flooding over the next couple hours. This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 212 and 225. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
